stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Phishing Email Contains Gh0st RAT Attachment
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description: On 18 November 2014, a government department was targeted with a phishing email that contained an executable file that displays the icon of an orange "Play" button to install malware. The email uses the subject "Pleasantly surprised" with the attachment and if executed, installs a ghOst Remote Administration Tool that calls out to a command and control (C2) domain www.meitanjiaoyiwang.com over port 53.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description: --- BEGIN EMAIL HEADER --- EHLO resqmta-po-06v.sys.comcast.net MAIL FROM:<s_hillson@comcast.net> SIZE=486106 RCPT TO:<[REDACTED]> DATA Received: from resomta-po-19v.sys.comcast.net ([96.114.154.243]) by resqmta-po-06v.sys.comcast.net with comcast id GZwE1p0045FMDhs01ZwEmR; Mon, 17 Nov 2014 09:56:14 +0000 Received: from resmail-ch2-066v.sys.comcast.net ([162.150.48.95]) by resomta-po-19v.sys.comcast.net with comcast id GZwC1p00623Dccq01ZwCFP; Mon, 17 Nov 2014 09:56:13 +0000 Date: Mon, 17 Nov 2014 09:56:11 +0000 (UTC) From: STEVEN <s_hillson@comcast.net> To: [REDACTED] <[REDACTED]> Message-ID: <548127102.14628672.1416218171922.JavaMail.zimbra@comcast.net> In-Reply-To: <907644843.14628501.1416218138154.JavaMail.zimbra@comcast.net> Subject: Pleasantly surprised MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary="----=_Part_14628668_1479820628.1416218171909" X-Originating-IP: [::ffff:113.137.198.68] X-Mailer: Zimbra 8.0.7_GA_6031 (ZimbraWebClient - FF33 (Win)/8.0.7_GA_6031) Thread-Topic: Pleasantly surprised Thread-Index: D8+Ko74JBi+JYwsETkPge61uQ7AHEA== DKIM-Signature: v=1; a=rsa-sha256; c=relaxed/relaxed; d=comcast.net; s=q20140121; t=1416218174; bh=XwBMr4MPmRY71PFmUAhOmUEMEsieEwNdryIDaYHrBGA=; h=Received:Received:Date:From:To:Message-ID:Subject:MIME-Version: Content-Type; b=XYMOytTWu5qBzuwSREs/EPL5GNBKlNQg5o/RqA3BnXX5AxDZ1E8pRhowGNcRJ1ri2 oQ9CIQZP9HslPa9YEa5btFEkeRXQjkqawbROn4/meMwfIuJPS0db6dxwGZP0kwxmeh naJArVCtaz3qJOfyXciQWaCDvTKzXbWB/Rm2/fB/UQGvDEpkKjoz2+7/qbJWNt2e6i jho47Squm/9AMx95EEySXWYcX+nKTZceS/j+r8dxjuQa63/vKHabay5NIbfN3qQMc7 ui8WzKu7rk91cp0djvRFFsRS2tKuMi5LSfterNUqDoycX7C3hnBZmR5MaQrzYIEzfg Qky3K4nSkdleg== ------=_Part_14628668_1479820628.1416218171909 Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="----=_Part_14628669_1337178889.1416218171909" --- END EMAIL HEADER ---
The attachment is a zip archive that contains Pleasantly surprised.Exe (MD5 458AD712DA0D726C22213B30848BBBA0).

The executable file displays the icon of an orange "Play" button. When the file is executed, it creates the hidden folder C:\Recycle09102014 and creates a DLL GameUpdate.log within the hidden folder. It then modifies the System Registry for persistence, executes the installed DLL and executes a command to delete itself, then terminates.
The following command is used to execute the created DLL: RUNDLL32.EXE C:\Recycle09102014\GameUpdate.log,LoaderEntry
The following command is used to delete itself: cmd /c ping 127.0.0.1 -n 1&del "C:\Documents and Settings\User\Desktop\Pleasantly surprised.Exe"
File added: C:\Recycle09102014\GameUpdate.log
File deleted: C:\Documents and Settings\User\Desktop\Pleasantly surprised.Exe
Folder added: C:\Recycle09102014 The following Registry Values were added: HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\GameInit: 52 55 4E 44 4C 4C 33 32 2E 45 58 45 20 43 3A 5C 52 65 63 79 63 6C 65 30 39 31 30 32 30 31 34 5C 47 61 6D 65 55 70 64 61 74 65 2E 6C 6F 67 2C 4C 6F 61 64 65 72 45 6E 74 72 79 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 HKLM\SYSTEM\ControlSet001\Services\BITS\LoginAddress: "PIXeBZjsQcToRZfgSdr0QcXoRZWnSJrkKg==" HKLM\SYSTEM\ControlSet001\Services\BITS\LoginPort: "zEC9Kg==" HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\BITS\LoginAddress: "PIXeBZjsQcToRZfgSdr0QcXoRZWnSJrkKg==" HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\BITS\LoginPort: "zEC9Kg==" Decoded Hex Value: HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\GameInit: RUNDLL32.EXE C:\Recycle09102014\GameUpdate.log,LoaderEntry Decoded Base64 Values: BITS\LoginAddress: 00000000 3c 85 de 05 98 ec 41 c4 e8 45 97 e0 49 da f4 41 <.....A. .E..I..A 00000010 c5 e8 45 95 a7 48 9a e4 2a ..E..H.. * BITS\LoginPort: 00000000 cc 40 bd 2a .@.*
The file GameUpdate.log (MD5 1707B1EB200ED3F899A733DDBDEDEC1D) calls out to this C2.
